fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41429].
  {panel}

I seem to get this error a lot in a day, at least 3-4 times through normal usage of JIRA OnDemand.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a bug, attach an image
# Do something else for a few minutes while you wait for the upload
# Submit the bug

h4. Expected Results

Bug is always submitted

h4. Actual Results

Several times per day the error message "Temporary attachment not found. Session may have timed out before submitting the form" is shown, even if I was away for only a few minutes, and the attachments need to be re-added.

In these instances, I don't need to re-login or do anything else, simply re-attaching the images works. Which leads me to believe this is not related to session control.
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand is subject to "Temporary attachment not found. Session may have timed out before submitting the form"

h4. To Reproduce:
 # Create new custom field - https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa
 # Select "User Picker (single user)"
 ** I named the field "UserPickerTest" and left the description blank
 # Create a new user
 ** I used the following details.
 ** Name - Test Userpickerfield
 ** Email address - Test@Userpickerfield.fake.email.com
 # Set a default value for the custom field "UserPickerTest" - https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa
 ## Select the actions on the right side of the page, for the "UserPickerTest" field and select "configure"
 ## Enter "Test@Userpickerfield.fake.email.com" as the default value
 # Delete the user "Test@Userpickerfield.fake.email.com"
 # Attempt to create any type of issue, in any project.

h4. Expected:

Issue to be created as normal
h4. Actual Results:

Issue creation fails with an error message: "UserPickerTest: User 'Test@Userpickerfield.fake.email.com' is not valid for this user picker." 
h4. Workaround: 

Remove the default user or pick a non-deleted user for the single user picker custom field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41418].
  {panel}

*Request:*
Allow Jira administrators, to configure custom placeholder text to appear in free-text issue fields (Summary, Description, custom free text fields), on a project-by-project basis.

*Benefits:*
* Team members receive constant non-intrusive guidance, on how best to use certain fields, every time they create an issue. e.g. teams using Gherkin syntax for Stories, could be reminded of this by 'As...When...Then' placeholder text in Summary field.
* Different teams working on different projects retain flexibility to follow their different processes.
* Non-intrusive way to remind team members to follow chosen conventions/best practices.
* Placeholder text is better than default text, as it doesn't require deleting or editing of default text. Team members can just click/tab into fields and immediately start typing.
* Allows admins to also offer guidance on use of fields such as Summary, and other project-specific custom free-text fields.

This request is not the same as http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4812 because:
* Placeholder text is better than default text, as it doesn't require deleting or editing of default text.
* This request is for all free-text fields, not just Description.
fields.summary: Allow admins to setup custom placeholder text in free-text fields.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41408].
  {panel}

When using the various Atlassian products (JIRA, Stash, Bamboo, Confluence) whilst linked to Crowd which is linked to Active Directory on Windows Server 2012 R2, if you rename a user on Active Directory it renames it on Crowd perfectly fine (checked the database itself and it was correct) but it does not rename it on JIRA or Stash correctly. I would assume it does not work correctly on the others as well, but we did not rename any Bamboo users and we installed Confluence after renaming the users.

For example, in my case, my AD name was previously aaron.jenkins. It was renamed to just aaron as a company-wide policy change in naming. Crowd understood this and synchronized it fine, but JIRA instead created a new user called aaron and left the old one, while simultaneously breaking authentication. I have lost the exception, but it was essentially telling me that it found multiple results when looking up a user. It was not until I opened the database in MySQL (whichever version Ubuntu 14.04 comes with) and manually renamed the old users AND deleted the new users it worked.

So, my steps for repairing were

user id 293020: aaron.jenkins
user id 404040: aaron

I had to rename aaron to aaron-, then rename aaron.jenkins to aaron, then delete aaron-. I had to do this in the cwd_user table, the app_user table, and the cwd_membership table.

Version	6.2
Build Number	6252
Build Date	Wed Feb 19 00:00:00 GMT 2014
Build Revision	aa343257d4ce030d9cb8c531be520be9fac1c996

EDIT: this is more of a JIRA issue, I accidentally put it in the Confluence project, sorry.
fields.summary: Improper handling of renaming users when linked to Crowd linked to Active Directory

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41396].
  {panel}

Currently, based on the exported XML of Agile Simplified Workflow, it seems that is missing some Tags that is needed for translating the transition names. This could be compared from the XML tags of the workflow below:
* JIRA Standard Workflow
{code:xml}
<action id="2" name="Close Issue" view="resolveissue">
      <meta name="jira.i18n.submit">closeissue.close</meta>
      <meta name="opsbar-sequence">60</meta>
      <meta name="jira.i18n.description">closeissue.desc</meta>
      <meta name="jira.i18n.title">closeissue.title</meta>
      <!-- ... -->
</action>

<!--...-->

<step id="6" name="Closed">
      <meta name="jira.status.id">6</meta>
      <actions>
<common-action id="3" />
      </actions>
    </step>
{code}
* Agile Simplified Workflow
{code:xml}
   <action id="51" name="Closed">
      <meta name="jira.description">Managed by JIRA Agile</meta>
    </action>
<!-- ...-->
    <step id="6" name="Closed">
      <meta name="jira.status.id">6</meta>
    </step>
{code}

The simplified workflow does not have the {{jira.i18n}} which responsible for translation/internationalisation. Hence, it would be great if the same tag will be included as well for Agile Simplified Workflow for translation purposes.
fields.summary: Provide support for translating Agile Simplified Workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41388].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If the JIRA WebHook destination connection fails for any reason, such as the below, there will be no errors in the log, so no exceptions - essentially WebHooks fail silently:
 * The domain uses self signed certificate that's not in the Java trust store.
 * There's any other problem with verifying SSL connection (like certificate issued by an unknown CA, protocol/cipher mismatch and so on).
 * The host cannot be reached, due to network configuration.
 * The URL is invalid.

This makes it hard to understand why the connection failed, as nothing is written about the failure.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a WebHook to send to a target that will fail (for example, it uses a self-signed certificate not in the JIRA's trust store, or SSL is configured in a way that will generate an exception, or the URL does not exist).
 # Attempt to send the WebHook by performing the JIRA action that triggers it.
h3. Expected Results


The exception is written to the logs.
h3. Actual Results

No exception is written to the logs or thrown.
h3. Diagnose

Identify why the connection is failing - this can be tested outside of JIRA by using network tools such as {{cURL}}, {{telnet}} and/or {{ping}}. For example, if the target URL is www.example.com/webhook/test/ perform these tests from the JIRA server:
 * If using the {{-Dhttp.nonProxyHosts}} argument, the request may be failing due to JRA-43143 (WebHooks are not respecting this argument).
 * {{ping www.example.com}} to see if the servers can establish a network connection.
 * {{telnet www.example.com 80}} to see if the appropriate port is open.
 * {{curl -X POST www.example.com/webhook/test/}} to see that you can submit a {{POST}} to the target server.

If these tests fail, it can indicate that network / firewall / DNS configurations may need to be addressed, depending upon the errors returned from the different tests.

If this is SSL related, ensure to import the self-signed certificate into the trust store as per [Connecting to SSL services|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+SSL+services].
fields.summary: WebHooks will not log any errors or throw an exception when there's a connection error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41377].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently JIRA ships with a bundled JRE, which will highly useful does not contain diagnostic tools (such as {{jstack}} / {{jmap}}) that are required for performance troubleshooting, and diagnosing other problems. Admins need to install a JDK to use these tools, which during problematic periods (such as outages) can become a blocker as other teams may maintain servers.

It's a big friction point for customers that we could avoid by providing a JDK that already has those tools.

h3. Suggested Solution

Ship JIRA with a JDK instead of a JRE.
 
h3. Workaround 

Install a JDK from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html.
fields.summary: JIRA should bundle the Oracle JDK tools

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41368].
  {panel}

h4. +Steps to reproduce:+
# log in JIRA
# browse a project -> Administration panel
#* or JIRA Administration -> Projects -> any project
# go to Development tools
# click Refresh (to refresh connected applications)

h4. +Expected behavior:+
The application list is refreshed properly

h4. +Actual behavior:+
The Refresh button runs very shortly or almost does not run
-> Nothing happens
-> The list is not refreshed

h4. +Workaround:+
In order for the Refresh button to run properly, users needs Administration Access. In other words, users need to go to a different Administration Section first e.g. Issues, Add-ons, System in order to be prompted for Administration Access login. Only then can they go back to Development tools and Refresh the applications.

h4. +Suggestion:+
Implement the Administration Access prompt when users Refresh Development tools
fields.summary: Prompt for Administration Access when Refreshing Development tools

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41358].
  {panel}

When using the "@mention" if you hit Enter, the highlighted suggestion would auto-complete.  Now we are on JIRA 6.2.1 and you have to mouse-click the highlighted row for the @mention to commit.  IE10, Firefox and Chrome all display this behaviour.

h4. +Answer+
This issue is caused by Zephyr plugin. Temporarily disabling the plugin will get the Mention feature to work properly again with pressing Enter.

Currently this issue is being tracked by Zephyr in their internal project. For more information, you can contact Zephyr support and mention the issue key *ZFJ-1331* to them.

h4. +Workaround+
Thanks to everyone's feedback, a Mouse Click or pressing Tab is able to select the mentioned user instead of pressing Enter.
fields.summary: @ Mention used to allow selection w/ Enter key - now needs mouse click

In order to keep the number of custom fields under control, we ask our admins to reuse fields as much as possible, creating new contexts when a field's values need to be specific for a project.

Most of the time however, the same context will be shared by a group of projects belonging to the same team/department.

It would be extremely useful to be able to create a context scheme, to be able to quickly assign a group of context without having to edit each custom field one by one.

I think one context scheme per project is good enough for most situations.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41336].
  {panel}

When a Pie Chart gadget is used to display on custom fields values it incorrectly handles "Other".

Example: We have a field called "Issue Category" and one of the user select-able options is called "Other". When the chart is rendered its results are ambiguous (see attached) including the results in both "Other" (a user entry) and in the automatically summarized field "Other" containing the remaining entries of smaller quantity. Clicking on this auto-generated "Other" however does not include the user selected "Other" entries.

I propose that it would be more clear if the auto-generated summation on the pie chart called "Other" should not include any user entries that may also by chance be called "Other". Perhaps an even better approach would be to name this auto-generated summation something that is not likely to be used as a user selectable entry but still gets the point across that these are an automatically generated summary of the remaining entries.

For example, name the other entries as "Other Entries" or "Other Choices".
fields.summary: Pie Chart gadget

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options

This documentation should mention in the *Mode* section that setting the *-Private-* mode will not prevent users to be created by other user directories.

EG: A JIRA Administrator set JIRA Mode private, now users can't sign up, however, if JIRA has an LDAP directory with delegated authentication configured, the user is able to login and create a new account if the directory has the option "Copy user" enable.

This documentation leads to believe that Users can't create new accounts without specifying that they can if LDAP is configured.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41324].
  {panel}

When trying to profile performance issues with VisualVM, the natural problem is the OSGi class loader isolation. To overcome this problem, the Felix container allows to define a set of packages for boot delegation.
Currently, the default system property for Felix is ignored and an Atlassian specific one is used. The default for this property contains packages for several profiler (e.g. JProfiler and YoutKit) but does not contain the ones needed for VisualVM.
Please add them to ease profiling with VisualVM. Please feel free to request further information or suggestions in case you feel uncertain.

The required packages are: 
* org.netbeans.lib.profiler.server,org.netbeans.lib.profiler.server.*
fields.summary: Add packages for VisualVM to default Boot Delegation Configuration

fields.description:
History tab shows wrong user for the creation event under these circumstances:

- issue is created by incoming email 
- sender is not a jira user, making "default email reporter" as reporter

Reporter of issue is set correctly to "default email reporter", but in history tab a random user as it seems shows up as the one creating it. The same user seems to be used for all the tickets for the same project. 

We are in fact using JETI plugin, so I'm not sure on where the problem is.
fields.summary: History tab showing wrong user for create event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41321].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of bug

When using JIRA with JAVA 1.8 (and using it in a non-English language), JIRA might not recognize the dates properly, even when they are set according to the date picker format

h3. Steps to replicate

# Setup JIRA with JAVA 1.8 (preferable JIRA 6.3 and above)
# Set JIRA to use one of the affected languages (more on that later). For now we shall use German
# Set the due date to be in March
# The result is as follows :
!german lang.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Info

* This does not seem to be able to be replicated if using JAVA 1.7 or below
* Another affected language found so far is Czech :
!czech lang.png|thumbnail!
* This seems to only affect certain months/patterns (for example, using the German language example above, March is affected, but not December)
* Tested in JIRA 6.3.9 with Postgres

*Possible Workaround:*
- Change the date format from _20/Mrz/15_ to _20.03.15_ with the below setting in _Advanced Settings_:
{noformat}
jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y %H:%M
jira.date.time.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy H:mm
jira.date.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy
{noformat}

- For Cloud instances, kindly create a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com/ to perform the above workaround.
fields.summary: JAVA 8 in JIRA does not recognize some dates set in foreign language

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41315].
  {panel}

Hi,

We have been transitioning our Jira integration scripts over to the new
REST API, as Atlassian indicated that they will be phasing SOAP out in
future releases.

One feature that is sorely lacking in the REST API is the ability to
make changes to a ticket without triggering email notifications:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34423

Can you please look into this on HIGH priority?
fields.summary: REST API is the ability to make changes to a ticket without triggering email notifications
The Rapid Upgrade documentation should clearly explain how to migrate customisations
Issue Activity should show only information from Linked Pages when using Project Link

If a user is deleted and was assigned to a role as a default member, you will trigger an error while trying to edit the member list, and therefore cannot remove the user from the list.

h3.Steps to reproduce:
- to Add a user to a default member list of a role
-- Admin >> System >> Roles
-- Select *Manage Default Members* for any role (In My Example TEST role)
-- Select *Edit* for Default Users
-- add a user you can delete from user management
- Delete the user from user-management
-- Admin >> User Management >> Users >> Select the user >> Delete
-- [Process Noted Here | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Deleting+or+Deactivating+Users]
- Return to Admin >> System >> Roles >> The Role You added user to >> Manage Default Members >> edit

h1.Workaround:
Requires Database access So, JIRA Cloud users file a support request at https://support.atlassian.com and reference this bug.
The Process is [Outlined in this Knowledge base Article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/cannot-edit-default-users-in-default-members-for-project-role-781190629.html]
fields.summary: Cannot edit Default members of a role if user has been deleted
Meaningful/Improve logging for XML restore

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41310].
  {panel}

JIRA has two settings that make some or all of an issue read-only:

* A Version is Archived (issues with that Version set in a field cannot have that Version removed from the field).
* The Workflow step has the {{jira.issue.editable}} property set to {{false}} (the entire issue is read-only).

While these are good controls to apply to general users, there are always exceptions, where issue attributes need some clean-up after the "read-only" settings have been applied.  For example, an older issue with an archived Version is resurrected, or a "closed" issue needs some data clean-up for accurate metrics.

At present, there is no way to override these read-only states...the only way to deal with "clean-up" situations is to undo the read-only state (e.g. un-archive the Version or temporarily remove the {{jira.issue.editable}} setting).  Both of these require administrator permissions (either Project or System), and this adds to the administrative workload.

This request is for a capability to define the users/groups/roles that are allowed to "override" these read-only settings.  This would allow JIRA administrators to share the workload a little more with the user community (e.g. allowing users with a privileged project role to edit read-only issues in that project).  Making this configurable per instance will enable this capability while still respecting the specific data integrity requirements of each instance.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of users who can override two read-only settings, to lighten administrative workload

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41309].
  {panel}

It seems that there is a minor bug in the date picker in the german version.
The month march is translated "März" in german. The Datepicker generates the following format, if you pick a day in march:
7/Mrz/15 (See attachment 1)
This leads to an error (See attachment 2)

The workarround is to set the format manually in the following way
7/Mär/14
fields.summary: Datepicker
Report generation from Jira issue with preselected posts.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41303].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
When changing the issue type of an issue. If you have assigned a custom field to an issue type, which do not exist in your new issue type. When you do custom field value search the issue still shows in issue navigator. 


h3. Feature Request
When changing the issue type of an issue. If you have assigned a custom field to an issue type, which do not exist in your new issue type. When you do custom field value search the issue should not show in issue navigator.
fields.summary: Custom field value search should not include the issue that previously had the custom field value before changing the issue type
Cannot create Sprints as a person in a project admin role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41298].
  {panel}

Referencing our documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Emailing+an+Issue#EmailinganIssue-sharing

JIRA allows users to be linked to an issue even if users don't have adequate project permissions (browse projects) to access the issue. 

The notification is sent but can create confusing in that it says that an issue has been shared with them, but when they click the link, it says they don't have permissions to the issue.

The suggestion is that the process gets renamed to just say Notify Users or similar and reword the e-mail to the users so it is less confusing.

Additionally,  it would be nice if the share dialog box tool would honor the carriage returns in the note. When sending a note like this:
Line 1
Line 2
Line 3
...when it gets sent to the recipient(s), it appears actually will appear like this:
Line 1 Line 2 Line 3

Which makes it difficult to read lists of data like usernames/passwords, especially when they are multiple recipients.
fields.summary: Share Issue is confusing for users without the Browse Project permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41297].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have the ability to disable attachments globally in a JIRA Cloud instance - this is currently not possible because it is a [Restricted Function|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Restricted+Functions#RestrictedFunctions-JIRA] in Atlassian Cloud.

!attachments.png!

*Workaround*

Ensure that users don't have the *Create Attachments* permission (located inside the permission scheme) for all projects.
fields.summary: Ability to disable attachments globally

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41293].
  {panel}

Links from JIRA in Activity Stream (this includes other Atlassian products like Confluence) always use relative URLs (/foo/bar) instead of absolute URLs (http://www.example.com/foo/bar). When a user in a different application (Confluence) clicks a link in the Activity Stream generated by JIRA it will give them a 404 not found error (since it will try to load the relative URL in the Confluence base URL).

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Install JIRA and Confluence (tested with JIRA 6.2.2, 6.3.12 and Confluence 5.5.3, 5.6.5)
# Setup an Application Link between the two
# Subscribe to JIRA gadgets in Confluence
** This allows you to use the JIRA activity stream gadget
# Create test data in JIRA
# Create a page in Confluence with the JIRA activity stream
# Click the JIRA links that are shown in the stream

h3. Expected behavior
Click the link takes you to the item in JIRA

h3. Actual behavior
The standard Confluence Page not found error or a blank page

h3. Screenshot
The following screenshot shows the relative link in the JIRA activity stream, and what happens when you click the link in an Activity Stream in Confluence:
!activity_stream.png|thumbnail!!failed_link.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Links from JIRA Use Relative URLs for Activity Stream
Sharing Issue should get recorded in History/Activity

Some people prefer not to have the form fields (such as To, From, Subject, Request Details) as they could put the *link to their contact form* on the *Contact Administrator Message* box (shown in the screenshot above).

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41288].
  {panel}

During the JIRA setup process on stable we have a screen that attempts to capture some info through use of survey questions.
These aren't needed anymore, so we need to get rid of them. 

This incorporates a couple of things:
- remove the call to get the questions from hamlet
- remove the submission of the question responses to hamlet
- remove any code processing the questions, checkboxes etc

This code lives in the setup-license.js file I believe.
fields.summary: Remove the survey questions from the setup process on stable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41287].
  {panel}

During work with Jira we have small problem with Jira issue navigator.
Example:
User need to work with results of JQL filter that returns ~400 issues.
It is 20 pages with issues with 20 issues per page.
Currently system displays links only to 5 pages simultaneously. This parameter is global and can't be changed.
There is also no way to go to page number 8 (for example) when you are on very first page.
It will be very helpful if user will be able to do following things:
1) Configure quantity of displayed pages (at least for himself, maybe for project)
2) "Jump" to specified page by entering it number
3) Change the "issues number per page"  parameter value (for example 20, 50, 100 issues per page would be really nice)
fields.summary: Ability to configure quantity of shown pages in Jira issue navigator and to go to specified page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41286].
  {panel}

The Windows installers and screenshot applet need up to date certificates. We use 2-year certificates. For supportability purposes we should start using 3 or 4 year certificates. To ensure we're always up to date we should be pro-actively updating these on a semi regular basis, although because the signatures are often stamped with a timestamp server even when the certificates expire they should still appear as trusted.

The CSR's can take a while to come through once we put in requests to IT and our certificate provider, so this should be done in late 2015  so that we:
* have time to request tickets from IT and incorporate them
* our product continues to be trusted, and in the case of the applet work, for some period after release.

The current round of certificates expire in late 2016. See JRA-35664.

Once you've done this task, create another one with similar parameters to be started in a year and finished in 18 months. Hooray!
fields.summary: New certificates for Windows installer and applets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41278].
  {panel}

Currently our /rest/api/2/password/policy/createUser and /rest/api/2/password/policy/updateUser sections don't have any example on how to actually use the call.

Please add what is expected from this call in the Expand section of [this page|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#d2e3349].

*update from support*

I've managed to identify what these calls do, they still need official docs, but here is the information:

h4. updateUser json

{
"username": "test",
"newPassword": "a",
"oldPassword": "c"
}
Replace username with the username you're updating, newpassword with your new password and old password with whatever your password was. It will then check it against your password policy and let you know if the password is acceptable.

h4. createUser json

{
"username": "test",
"password": "a",
}
Change username to whatever the new user's name will be, and set password to whatever you want to check.

*This functionality does not work in JIRA Cloud, it only works on JIRA Server*
fields.summary: Update /rest/api/2/password/policy/createUser and /rest/api/2/password/policy/updateUser REST documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41269].
{panel}
Update 28 Sep 2021:

Hi all, Admins are now able to change ownership of both private and shared *dashboards* within global administration settings. To do this, go to System > Dashboards (under the "Shared Items" heading).
 We have tentative plans to bring this support to filters as well, and will keep you guys updated on any new developments. 
  
 Marcus Wong
 Product Manager, Jira Shared Experiences

 

Currently, JIRA administrators can only manage SHARED filters and dashboards owned by other users. There's a suggestion that they should be made capable of managing PRIVATE filters and dashboards as well.

This ticket can be considered a continuation of JRA-9997.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to manage private filters, subscriptions and dashboards owned by other users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41268].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Go to General Configuration
 # Change Indexing Language to _German_
 # Change Default Language to _Deutsch (Deutschland)_
 # Change Default user time zone to _Europe_ and Timezone to _(GMT+01:00) Berlin_
 # Change any date picker field (e. g Due Date) to any date in March (e.g 4/Mrz/15 10:25 PM)

*Expected Result:*
 - JIRA should be able to recognize "Mrz" abbreviation for March

*Actual Result:*
 - Error thrown as below:

{noformat}
duedate: Sie haben kein gültiges Datum eingegeben. Geben Sie das Datum im Format 'd/MMM/yy' ein (z. B. '16/Dez/14').

{noformat}
{noformat}
duedate: You did not enter a valid date. Please type the date in the format 'd / MMM / yy' (for. & Nbsp; B '16 / Dec / 14 '.).

{noformat}
*Workaround:*
 - Change the date format from _20/Mrz/15_ to _20.03.15_ with the below setting in _Advanced Settings_:
{noformat}
jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y %H:%M
jira.date.time.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy H:mm
jira.date.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy

{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't recognize "Mrz" abbreviation for March in German
